head.title: May 14-20; Court Rules on Rape Cases

hedline.hl1: May 14-20; Court Rules on Rape Cases

block.p: Almost from the moment of its passage in 1994, the Violence Against Women Act was on a collision course with the Supreme Court's new interest in setting limits on Congress's ability to bring the federal government into areas of state concern. The crash finally occurred when the court voted, 5 to 4, that the act's provision permitting victims of rape and other crimes ''motivated by gender'' to sue their attackers in federal court was unconstitutional. Sen. Joseph R. Biden Jr., the law's chief Senate sponsor, said the decision ''is really all about power: who has the power, the court or Congress?''
